headline: Berkshire Hathaway’s CEO Suggests These 4 Companies Are Forever Stocks
summary: Greg Abel identified four large Berkshire equity investments—Apple, American Express, Coca Cola and Moody’s—and suggested they are forever stocks, or close to it.

raw.headline: Berkshire Hathaway’s CEO Suggests These 4 Companies Are Forever Stocks

headline: Jim Cramer Says American Express Is a “Great Company”
summary: American Express Company (NYSE:AXP) is one of the stocks Jim Cramer Recently Discussed. Cramer mentioned the company during the episode and said, “I like the credit card companies. American Express got killed. That’s a great company. Capital One, so good.” American Express Company (NYSE:AXP) provides credit and charge cards, payment processing, banking, and travel-related services. […]

summary: Berkshire Hathaway doesn't pay a dividend, but investors can get one and exposure to the stock with this ETF.

headline: Ameriprise Financial, Inc. (AMP): A Bull Case Theory
summary: We came across a bullish thesis on Ameriprise Financial, Inc. on The Illiquid Edge’s Substack. In this article, we will summarize the bulls’ thesis on AMP. Ameriprise Financial, Inc.’s share was trading at $473.67 as of February 13th. AMP’s trailing and forward P/E were 15.29 and 11.06 respectively according to Yahoo Finance. Ameriprise Financial (AMP) stands out as […]

headline: Visa, Mastercard Aren't The Real Casualties In Citrini's AI-Stablecoin Scenario
summary: A Citrini Research scenario published Sunday sent shockwaves through financial markets Monday, dragging down shares of Mastercard Incorporated (NYSE:MA), Visa Inc. (NYSE:V), American Express Company (NYSE:AXP), and others. But a CEO building payment infrastructure for AI agents says the the...

headline: American Express Headquarters Move To 2 World Trade Center And Valuation Gap
summary: American Express (NYSE:AXP) plans to build and own a new global headquarters at 2 World Trade Center in Lower Manhattan. The move confirms a long term commitment to New York City and aligns with the completion of the World Trade Center site redevelopment. The planned headquarters is expected to feature modern, sustainable design and support thousands of local jobs. For you as an investor, this decision sits at the intersection of real estate, brand positioning, and long term corporate...

headline: Greg Abel as Berkshire Earnings Fall: 'Warren Is Obviously a Very Hard Act To Follow'
summary: Greg Abel, calling Warren Buffett "a very hard act to follow," signaled continuity at Berkshire as Q4 operating earnings fell about 30% and the cash hoard dipped despite no buybacks.

raw.headline: Greg Abel as Berkshire Earnings Fall: 'Warren Is Obviously a Very Hard Act To Follow'
